question:
You recently visited a theatre and had an accident there. The staff were very helpful. Write a letter to the manager giving good feedback.

In your letter, you should tell:
– and describe the accident
– how the staff helped you
– how similar situations could be prevented in the future.
text: I am writing this letter to appreciate the members of your cinema staff for their timely and quick assistance at the time of misfortune happened with me in a cinema hall.

I am Ell Green and I went to watch a movie with my friends last week at Omaxe Multiplex. We were about ten minutes late due to road congestion and the movie had already started when we reached. The guard present there guided us but it was dark inside to see anything. Since one of the steps was broken, I tripped and fell sideways. As a result, I sprained my ankle.

At the same time, the crew on duty was very kind who provided me first-aid to alleviate the pain to some extent. Later, I have decided to leave and consult the doctor. I would like to thank the complete team who has arranged the wheelchair and assisted me to smoothly exit the building.

On this regard to uncertainty, I would suggest you get the steps repaired so that such incidents can be avoided in the near future. Meanwhile, please advise the guards to guide the audience to their seat and sign of caution at hall entry would also prove to be useful.
Once again, I sincerely thanks the staff for their generosity and cooperation.
